Description: Low conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky black (fired red) with reserved edge of foot; inscription on underside.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ145 [according to BM register]
Curator's comments: The sherd's profile suggests that the upper part of the foot was narrow and tall, similar to those found in the Simple Animal Style. For parallels, see Lemos no. 1006 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1088) (phase 2)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 46)
